task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Tesla Model 3\LOG\3F78A21D\00000001. Save the concatenated file as Tesla_Model_3_3F78A21D.mf4 in the same folder. GUI instructions: open the folder in the file dialog, click any file to focus the list, press CTRL+A to select all files, then press ENTER to load them.

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf window so subsequent State-Tool calls and interactions target the correct application.
Discover the current UI elements (menus, buttons) so we can reference them dynamically rather than using hardcoded coordinates.
Open the Mode menu to switch the application into Batch processing mode (required for concatenating multiple files).
Refresh UI state after opening the Mode menu to locate the 'Batch processing' menu item.
Select Batch processing mode so multiple files can be added and concatenated.
Update UI state after switching to Batch processing to find File -> Open and batch operation controls.
Open the File menu to use the Open command and bring up the file selection dialog to add multiple files.
Locate the 'Open' menu item in the File menu after it was opened.
Invoke the Open command to display the standard file dialog for selecting multiple MF4 files.
Capture the file dialog UI elements (address/file name field and file list) so we can navigate to the target folder.
Focus the 'File name' edit in the dialog so we can type the full target folder path to navigate directly there.
Ensure the file name edit is focused and the dialog is ready to accept typed input.
Enter the full folder path into the dialog's file name field and press Enter to navigate to that folder so the .MF4 files are displayed.
After navigation, capture the file list content so we can click a displayed .MF4 file to focus the list.
Click any .MF4 file in the list (wildcard) to ensure the file list has focus before selecting all files.
Confirm the file list is focused so the keyboard selection shortcut will apply to the displayed files.
Select all .MF4 files in the folder using Ctrl+A as specified by the user's instructions.
Verify that all files are selected (ensures the next Enter will load all of them into Batch processing).
Press Enter to open/load the selected files into the Batch processing queue.
Capture the Batch processing view now that files are loaded so we can choose the 'Concatenate' operation and set the output filename.
Select the 'Concatenate' batch operation to combine all loaded files into a single continuous MF4 file (follows the batch_concatenate_files knowledge pattern).
Refresh UI state to find the output filename control (Save/Start dialog or File name edit for the result file).
Focus the output filename field so we can type the full path and desired output filename for the concatenated MF4.
Ensure the output file name field is ready to receive text before typing the final filename.
Enter the full output path and filename using single backslashes so the concatenated result will be saved in the same folder with the requested name.
Locate the Save/Start button after entering the output filename so we can begin the concatenation/save operation.
Click the Save/Start button to execute the concatenate operation and write Tesla_Model_3_3F78A21D.mf4 to the specified folder.
Capture the final UI state to confirm the operation completed or to surface any dialogs/errors that need handling.

Switch to Batch processing mode so multiple files can be combined. Use File -> Open to navigate to the specified folder via the file dialog (typing the full path), click a file to focus the list, use Ctrl+A to select all .MF4 files, and press Enter to load them. In the Batch view select the Concatenate operation, enter the full output filename (same folder) and click Save/Start to perform the concatenation. Repeated State-Tool calls before each interaction ensure UI elements are discovered dynamically and referenced using the last_state tokens.
